intro: Tulbaghia verdoornia, commonly known as the Cape tulbaghia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and clusters of white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It is often used in rock gardens and as a border plant due to its ornamental value and hardy nature. Tulbaghia verdoornia is also valued for its pleasant fragrance and ability to attract pollinators.
